content.heading: HTML class Attribute
paragraphs:
The HTML class attribute specifies a class for an HTML element.

Multiple HTML elements can share the same class.

content.heading: The class Attribute
paragraphs: The class attribute points to a class name in a style sheet and can also be used by JavaScript to manipulate elements with that class name.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
London

London is the capital of England.

Paris

Paris is the capital of France.

Tokyo

Tokyo is the capital of Japan.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
My Important Heading

This is some important text.

content.heading: The Syntax For Class
paragraphs: To create a class, write a period (.) followed by the class name, then define the CSS properties within curly braces {}.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
London

London is the capital of England.

Paris

Paris is the capital of France.

Tokyo

Tokyo is the capital of Japan.

content.heading: Multiple Classes
paragraphs: HTML elements can belong to multiple classes. To define multiple classes, separate the class names with a space.

content.heading: Different Elements Can Share Same Class
paragraphs: Different HTML elements can point to the same class name.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
Paris

Paris is the capital of France

content.heading: Use of the class Attribute in JavaScript
paragraphs: The class name can also be used by JavaScript to perform tasks for specific elements. JavaScript can access elements with a specific class name using the getElementsByClassName() method.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
<script>
function myFunction() { var x = document.getElementsByClassName("city");
 for (var i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
 x[i].style.display = "none";
 }
}
</script>
